Apocalypse drama, starring Carrie-Anne Moss, Douglas Smith, Frank Grillo and Kimberley-Sue Murray

programme.title: Cuckoo
programme.desc: A 17-year-old moves with her family to a resort where things are not what they seem. Writer/director Tilman Slingers horror thriller, starring Hunter Schafer, Jan Bluthardt and Dan Stevens

programme.title: Afraid
programme.desc: Computer engineering company executive Curtis is coerced into testing a new digital assistant named AIA to secure a lucrative business contract with two tech geniuses. At first, the omnipresent artificial intelligence simplifies day-to-day life. However, AIA becomes dangerously protective of the clan. Writer/director Chris Weitzs sci-fi horror, starring John Cho, Katherine Waterston and Keith Carradine

programme.title: The Woman in Black: Angel of Death
programme.desc: A group of evacuees and their teachers hope to find peace by escaping the nightly air raids on London at the remote Eel Marsh House. What they do not realise is that its malevolent ghost is still in residence and is out for blood. Horror sequel set during the Second World War, starring Helen McCrory, Jeremy Irvine and Phoebe Fox

programme.title: Edge of Tomorrow
programme.desc: An inexperienced military officer is sent to the front line in a war against an alien invasion, and dies within minutes. However, at the point of death, he is transported back in time to relive his last day again. As he faces the same battle over and over again, the experience he gains turns him into the ultimate warrior. Sci-fi adventure based on Hiroshi Sakurazakas novel All You Need Is Kill, starring Tom Cruise, Emily Blunt and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: The Lawnmower Man
programme.desc: A scientists ill-advised experiments with virtual reality equipment transform a mentally handicapped gardener into a computer-enhanced megalomaniac with the power to make his dreams of world domination come true. Sci-fi thriller, starring Pierce Brosnan, Jeff Fahey, Jenny Wright, Geoffrey Lewis and Austin OBrien

programme.title: Sinister
programme.desc: A writer moves into a house where several people died years previously, but keeps the buildings dark history a secret from his family. While researching a book on the incident, he discovers a series of old cine films of the deaths, but as he watches them, he uncovers a supernatural force behind the tragedy. Horror, starring Ethan Hawke and Juliet Rylance

programme.title: Ouija
programme.desc: A teenager recovering from the suicide of a friend persuades a group of her classmates to join her in attempting to make contact with the dead girls spirit. They discover that she was driven to her death by dangerous supernatural forces, which they have unwittingly unleashed to prey on them. Horror, starring Olivia Cooke and Ana Coto

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In 1967 Los Angeles, a widowed mother and her two daughters add a new stunt to boost their seance scam business. However, they get more than they bargained for when they invite an evil presence into their home. Supernatural horror prequel, starring Elizabeth Reaser and Annalise Basso

programme.title: Insidious
programme.desc: A family experience strange events in their house and become convinced it is haunted. However, after moving on, they find the dark forces have followed them and when their son mysteriously falls into a coma, they must find a way to get rid of the paranormal entities tormenting them. Horror, starring Patrick Wilson and Rose Byrne

programme.title: Insidious: Chapter 2
programme.desc: A couple previously tormented by paranormal activity discover their nightmares are not over. As more strange events occur, they turn to a group of paranormal investigators for help in uncovering the dark secrets that connect them to the spirit world. Horror sequel, starring Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne and Barbara Hershey

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: A deep-space salvage crew investigate mysterious events aboard a hi-tech spaceship, which suddenly reappeared in orbit around Neptune after going missing for seven years - but it is not long before they are exposed to terror beyond their wildest nightmares. Sci-fi horror, starring Laurence Fishburne, Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: Friday the 13th Part 2
programme.desc: A gang of foolhardy teenagers head for idyllic Crystal Lake with all manner of shenanigans in mind. But before they can get up to anything, a grotesque madman begins bumping them off in increasingly grisly fashion. Horror sequel, starring Amy Steel and John Furey and Warrington Gillette

programme.title: The Lawnmower Man
programme.desc: A scientists ill-advised experiments with virtual reality equipment transform a mentally handicapped gardener into a computer-enhanced megalomaniac with the power to make his dreams of world domination come true. Sci-fi thriller, starring Pierce Brosnan, Jeff Fahey, Jenny Wright, Geoffrey Lewis and Austin OBrien

programme.title: Escape from the 21st Century
programme.desc: In 1999, after discovering they have the power to travel in time with every sneeze, three friends embark on an adventure to save the world. Fantasy adventure, starring Ruoyun Zhang and Elane Zhong. In Chinese and Mandarin, with English subtitles

programme.title: Jules
programme.desc: Residents of a small Pennsylvania town are disturbed when a UFO crashes into a back garden. Director Marc Turtletaubs comedy drama, starring Ben Kingsley, Harriet Harris and Jane Curtin

programme.title: Voyagers
programme.desc: Thirty young men and women are sent deep into space on a multi-generational mission in search of a new home. The mission descends into madness, as the crew reverts to its most primal state, not knowing if the real threat they face is whats outside the ship or who theyre becoming inside it. Sci-fi thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Tye Sheridan and Lily-Rose Depp

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: A reckless slacker joins the Navy, hoping to win the respect of his girlfriends father, a stern admiral. He and his shipmates are put to the ultimate test as part of a force of vessels that must battle an invading fleet of powerful alien spaceships. Sci-fi adventure, starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Alexander Skarsgard

programme.title: Blade Runner
programme.desc: A former cop in a bleak future Los Angeles is forced to return to duty for a mission to hunt down and kill a group of renegade android replicants. The fugitives have escaped from a space colony to find their creator on Earth, in a bid to prolong their limited lifespan. Theatrical cut of Ridley Scotts sci-fi thriller, originally released in cinemas, starring Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer, Sean Young and Daryl Hannah

programme.title: Ready Player One
programme.desc: In 2045, gamers explore a virtual world in the quest for a deceased tycoons fortune. However, they must also contend with an evil corporation who will stop at nothing to get their hands on the prize. Steven Spielbergs fantasy adventure based on Ernest Clines novel, starring Tye Sheridan, Olivia Cooke, Ben Mendelsohn, Simon Pegg and Mark Rylance

programme.title: Gravity
programme.desc: Two astronauts are left stranded in orbit above the Earth when the debris from an exploding satellite destroys their shuttle. Left drifting in space with no way to contact mission control, they begin a perilous journey to reach the safety of a space station before their oxygen supply runs out. Thriller, starring Sandra Bullock and George Clooney

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: A team of commandos enters a top-secret underground research facility when a deadly virus which turns victims into flesh-eating zombies is accidentally released. But their containment mission spins out of control as a rogue super-intelligent computer and hordes of the marauding undead wreak havoc. Sci-fi action horror, starring Milla Jovovich, Michelle Rodriguez and James Purefoy

programme.title: Escape from the 21st Century
programme.desc: In 1999, after discovering they have the power to travel in time with every sneeze, three friends embark on an adventure to save the world. Fantasy adventure, starring Ruoyun Zhang and Elane Zhong. In Chinese and Mandarin, with English subtitles

programme.title: 10 Cloverfield Lane
programme.desc: A woman survives a car crash, and wakes up to find herself in an underground bunker, belonging to a survivalist who claims that a devastating attack has left the outside world uninhabitable. As his behaviour becomes increasingly stranger, she begins to fear she is being tricked and resolves to discover the truth for herself. Thriller, starring Mary Elizabeth Winstead and John Goodman

programme.title: The Surfer
programme.desc: A father returns to Australia to buy his childhood home. To celebrate, he takes his teenage son to Luna Bay so they can surf together. However, he becomes locked in a battle of one-upmanship with local thugs. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage and Julian McMahon

programme.title: Ruthless
programme.desc: After his daughter is murdered, a high school coach takes matters into his own hands and hunts down her killers. Action thriller, starring Dermot Mulroney, Jeff Fahey and Mauricio Mendoza

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: A police forensic psychologist searches for the daughter of a senator, who has been kidnapped from her expensive private school by a media-obsessed teacher, sparking a desperate race to hunt down her psychotic and devilishly intelligent captor before it is too late. Thriller prequel to Kiss the Girls, starring Morgan Freeman, Monica Potter, Michael Wincott, Dylan Baker and Penelope Ann Miller

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Jack Ryan foils an assassination attempt by an IRA splinter group, killing one of the terrorists in the process. However, he becomes caught in a lethal game of cat-and-mouse with the dead mans revenge-seeking brother. Thriller based on Tom Clancys novel, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Bean, Samuel L Jackson, Richard Harris and James Earl Jones, reprising his role from earlier Clancy adaptation The Hunt for Red October

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: A former army sniper is arrested following a random shooting that leaves five people dead, but protests his innocence. An elusive former military police investigator is called in to examine the case, and becomes convinced a conspiracy is at work. Action thriller based on Lee Childs novel One Shot, starring Tom Cruise, Rosamund Pike, Werner Herzog and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back
programme.desc: The nomadic vigilante tries to save an army major who has been framed for murder and treason. Jack Reacher discovers that Turner has been targeted by a secret government conspiracy, and together they go on the run to expose the truth. Director Edward Zwicks blockbusting action thriller sequel based on Lee Childs novel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders, Danika Yarosh and Aldis Hodge

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: After being abducted by a kidnapper with multiple personalities, three young women are soon engaged in a fight for survival. Meanwhile, an oblivious psychiatrist tries to ease her patients fractured mind as a 24th character with apparent superhuman abilities attempts to dominate his body. M Night Shyamalans thriller, starring James McAvoy, Anya Taylor-Joy and Betty Buckley

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Autistic number-cruncher Christian Wolff moonlights as a money launderer for the Mob. However, the Treasury Department start closing in on him, so he decides to take on a legitimate client in the form of a robotics company. As he works through their books, he uncovers a discrepancy involving millions of dollars. Action-packed thriller, starring Ben Affleck, Anna Kendrick and JK Simmons

programme.title: Escape from Alcatraz
programme.desc: A cunning convict with a history of making escape attempts is transferred to the notorious high-security island prison off the California coast, from which no one has ever broken out. Continually at odds with the brutal warden, he and three fellow prisoners hatch a plan to make it to freedom on an improvised raft. Thriller, based on a true story, starring Clint Eastwood, Patrick McGoohan, Roberts Blossom and Fred Ward

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Jack Ryan foils an assassination attempt by an IRA splinter group, killing one of the terrorists in the process. However, he becomes caught in a lethal game of cat-and-mouse with the dead mans revenge-seeking brother. Thriller based on Tom Clancys novel, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Bean, Samuel L Jackson, Richard Harris and James Earl Jones, reprising his role from earlier Clancy adaptation The Hunt for Red October

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: The laid-back lifestyle of an arrogant New York playboy is shattered when his unstable girlfriend drives off a bridge with him in the car. Although he survives, he struggles to put his life back together in the face of a series of strange events. Cameron Crowes remake of Spanish thriller Open Your Eyes, starring Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz, Kurt Russell, Jason Lee and Penelope Cruz, who also appeared in the original

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Oct 2025
programme.desc: Previews of the films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky

programme.title: Contraband
programme.desc: Successful international smuggler Chris Farraday turns his back on a life of crime to raise a family. However, his brother-in-law crosses a powerful drug lord, who forces Chris to transport billions of dollars of counterfeit money into the US, or his wife and children will be killed. Crime thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg, Kate Beckinsale, Giovanni Ribisi and Ben Foster

programme.title: Now You See Me
programme.desc: Four magicians use their lavish stage shows as cover for a series of seemingly impossible heists, and give away the money they steal to their audiences. An FBI agent assembles a team of experts to discover how the baffling robberies are committed and what the secret agenda behind the crime spree is. Crime thriller, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Woody Harrelson and Isla Fisher

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: After being abducted by a kidnapper with multiple personalities, three young women are soon engaged in a fight for survival. Meanwhile, an oblivious psychiatrist tries to ease her patients fractured mind as a 24th character with apparent superhuman abilities attempts to dominate his body. As he works through their books, he uncovers a discrepancy involving millions of dollars. Action-packed thriller, starring Ben Affleck, Anna Kendrick and JK Simmons

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: A respected academic goes on the run when he is framed for the murder of a French historian. Pursued by the detective on the case and a sinister assassin monk, he strives to unmask the culprit, leading to a conspiracy determined to preserve a 2,000-year-old secret at any cost. Thriller based on Dan Browns novel, starring Tom Hanks, Audrey Tautou, Ian McKellen, Paul Bettany and Jean Reno

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: An assassination attempt is made on the life of the US president during a terrorism summit. The story unfolds from several perspectives, including that of the secret service agents charged with protecting the head of state, a news producer covering the event and a man in the crowd who may have caught the perpetrator on camera. Thriller, starring Dennis Quaid, Matthew Fox, Forest Whitaker, Sigourney Weaver and William Hurt

programme.title: Murder by Numbers
programme.desc: Two teenagers murder a random victim for their own amusement, convinced nobody will ever suspect them of committing such a senseless crime, and ensure all the evidence points to a drug dealer. However, they reckon without a suspicious and determined detective and her partner. Thriller, starring Sandra Bullock, Ryan Gosling and Michael Pitt

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: Three brothers run an underground bootlegging operation in Depression-era Virginia. However, as their criminal activities become increasingly successful, a corrupt deputy sheriff demands a cut of the profits, forcing them to fight to defend their livelihood. Crime drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Tom Hardy, Jason Clarke, Gary Oldman and Guy Pearce

programme.desc: A farmer in need of money agrees to guard a notorious outlaw until the train arrives to transport him to jail. Meanwhile, the pair are holed up in a hotel, where his prisoner plays mind games with him - and the villains cohorts are waiting outside ready to engineer an escape. Western adapted from a novel by Elmore Leonard, with Van Heflin, Glenn Ford, Felicia Farr and Leora Dana

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores Edinburgh and its role in the union between England and Scotland. She discovers how the famous case of Burke and Hares bodysnatching influenced British medical law, and visits the Royal Bank of Scotland, where she uncovers evidence of the worlds first overdraft. Plus, the role played by Henry Dundas, whose statue stands in St Andrews Square, in the continuation of the slave trade

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits Manchester to explore the spirit of protest and revolution that grew out of the experience of Britains working class during the Industrial Revolution. At the John Ryland Library, Alice is granted access to rarely-seen period documents that highlight the true human cost of the Peterloo massacre. At the Free Trade Hall, she explores how Manchester found itself at the heart of the battle against the hated Corn Laws, and at Chethams Library, Roberts sits at the very desk where Friedrich Engels and Karl Marx, inspired by the living conditions of Manchesters working poor, began the discussions and research that would lead to the publication of the Communist Manifesto

programme.sub-title: The Sphere, the Prophecy Machine and the Canary
programme.desc: A look at a perplexing and unusual metal sphere, just seven-hundredths of an inch across. Under extreme magnification, it shows two holes that have been precision drilled through it. Each one is just four times the width of a human hair

programme.title: Strangest Things
programme.sub-title: The Pyramid Tool Kit, the Killer Foot Machine and the Lost Head
programme.desc: One hundred and fifty years ago a strange set of objects were found in the Great Pyramid in Giza. A piece of cedar wood with regular marks etched along its length, a two-pronged bronze hook with two pins sticking into it, and a baseball-sized sphere made of granite

programme.title: Mysteries from Above
programme.desc: Drones explore strange geological occurrences, unique man-made structures, curious creatures and lost civilizations. This episode focuses on mysteries found in desert landscapes, featuring a constant inferno in Turkmenistan, mysterious circles in the Namibian desert and secret electric blue ponds in Utah

programme.title: Combat Trains
programme.desc: Exploring how Lawrence of Arabia used guerilla warfare against the Ottoman Empires railways. Plus, two secrets hidden under New Yorks Grand Central Terminal - President Roosevelts personal train that brought him secretly into the city, and a M42 generator that it is claimed Nazi spies tried to destroy

programme.title: Combat Trains
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the role of trains in the major conflicts of the past 150 years. This instalment looks into how the efficiency of the rail networks on both sides helped cause the stalemate of the First World War

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether Nasa rocket scientist Wernher von Braun might have found inspiration in technology found at the alleged UFO crash in Roswell

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes at the castle and exploring its 900 years of history. The first episode focuses on the iconic Yeoman Warders, or Beefeaters, following their daily routine and the appointment of a new Chief Beefeater. Plus, a look at the towers origins in the reign of William the Conqueror and a new exhibition dedicated to the infamous story of the princes in the tower

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: The latest recruit to join the team of 37 beefeaters begins his career with some testing exams. Chris must learn the extensive history of the Tower by heart, a word-for-word knowledge which he will be tested on by the governor before being let loose alone on the 100,000 visitors who come to the Tower every week. Plus, chief curator Tracy Borman turns her attention to the time of Henry VIII, when the Tower gained its notorious reputation for imprisonment and execution, revealing the history of Anne Boleyn within the walls

programme.title: Historys Crazy Rich Ancients
programme.desc: Live life with the rich and powerful by taking a look at rulers, tycoons and visionaries who all have one thing in common - a gravitation towards the decadent

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones heads to the south-east of England to explore the turbulent history of Dover Castle. He reveals that Henry II ordered its construction not only as a statement of royal power, but also out of guilt for the murder of Thomas Becket, the Archbishop of Canterbury, in 1170. Dan discovers how a vast network of tunnels was used to defend the castle, including underground barracks built during the Napoleonic Wars and a nuclear bunker created during the Cold War

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the turbulent history of the Tower of London, which is one of Britains most famous buildings and has been a military fortress, a palace, a royal mint, a prison, a zoo and a place of execution. He reveals how one kings obsession with money led to the Tower becoming the focus of the worst Jewish massacre the country had ever seen and explains how a mob of disgruntled peasants managed to break through its defences as they sought bloody revenge for taxes they could no longer put up with

programme.title: Instruments of Death
programme.sub-title: Queen Boudicas Revolt: The Battle of Watling Street
programme.desc: Military combat specialists Karl Ude-Martinez and Kevin Hicks investigate the British uprising against the Roman army, examining how swords, spears and body armour were developed. Plus, how battlefield wounds were treated on the frontlines

programme.title: Rust Valley Restorers

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The gigantic statues of Easter Island, which have mystified humanity for centuries. This documentary explores the ancient Polynesian civilization that created the Moai structures, focusing on how they carved and transported the immense monoliths and the purpose and cultural significance behind them. The film highlights the enigmatic nature of the Moai, which are scattered across the island, and the challenges researchers face in understanding the islands history and the people who inhabited it

programme.desc: India v Sri Lanka. Coverage of the opening group match from Barsapara Cricket Stadium, Guwahati, as the two co-hosts go head to head. programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: India v Sri Lanka. Coverage of the opening group match from Barsapara Cricket Stadium, Guwahati, as the two co-hosts go head to head. India have never won this tournament before and will be hoping home advantage will come into play. They have made it to two finals in this competition but have lost on both ocassions, first to Australia in 2005, then again in 2017 when they lost to tournament hosts England

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May explore the old adage that having owned an Alfa Romeo is the sign of a real automobile addict, testing out three second-hand models, each bought for less than £1,000. The unwieldy Bentley Brooklands receives a power test, and Gavin and Staceys James Corden and Rob Brydon go head to head as the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tries to prove the Nissan GT-R is faster than the celebrated Bullet Train in a race across Japan with Richard Hammond and James May. Toyotas idea of personal transport for the future is tested out and additional glamour is provided by the Alfa Romeo 8C, which takes to the Top Gear track. Newsreaders Fiona Bruce and Kate Silverton are the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Rick Steins Secret France
programme.desc: The chef takes a culinary tour of France to discover what Britains neighbours have to teach us. He begins his trip in Dieppe, where he prepares freshly caught turbot, forages for sea herbs along the Bay of the Somme, and cooks a seafood gratin. He then heads for southern Champagne, a region that was a favourite of Renoir

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to make gourmet food without breaking the bank. They begin with a few weekend treats, rustling up several delicious dishes, gleaning money-saving secrets at the UKs only pub with two Michelin stars and finding out how beer can be as good a match with food as wine. Everything they learn will be put to the test when they help a wounded soldier say thank you to some very important people with a surprise barbecue

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: James Acaster, Dani Dyer, Oti Mabuse and Fred Sirieix join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds including Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: QI XL

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats

programme.title: Cops on the Rock

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders head to Poplar, East London, where Heavy D goes through his blue period after driving the other bidders up the wall with his antics

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Leamington Spa, and the up-market town brings out the businessman in Heavy D who gets more than he bargained for in one auction

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: In the Northern Territory, a police air unit tries to stay under cover and on target. Meanwhile, a long-distance ocean rescue pushes the 5-10 crew to the edge

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May show off the classic luxury vehicles they bought for the price of a Ford Mondeo. The Nissan GT-R is given a workout around Japans Fuji circuit, and entrepreneurs Peter Jones and Theo Paphitis are the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and the team take on their toughest challenge yet - keeping their tongues in check during a meeting with their counterparts from the German equivalent of the show. James May also test-drives a quirky Japanese car, and Richard Hammond puts a Mazda concept car through its paces. Jamiroquai frontman Jay Kay is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Rick Steins Secret France
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey without maps, leaving the main routes and tourist hotspots behind to embark on a personal road trip along picturesque and remote backroads. Here, he heads through Frances eastern border regions of Alsace and Jura - famous for Comte cheese and home to his favourite French dish of choucroute garni. He then begins to head inland, visiting Burgundy for a memorable glass of Auxey-Duresses wine, and sampling oeuf en meurette with a difference. Following a memorable Sunday lunch near the French/Swiss border, he is inspired to recreate a traditional blueberry tart

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create a dinner for two that is fit for a king, but doesnt cost the earth. They receive presentation tips from Michelin-starred chef Olivier Limousin and delve into Britains rich history for cut-price culinary inspiration. Everything they learn is put to the test when they help single mother Paula say a big thank-you to her supportive parents

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains Lee Mack and David Mitchell return with another episode of memorable moments from the hit comedy panel show. Among the participants setting out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves are Clare Balding, Liz Bonnin, Jo Brand, Asim Chaudhry, Victoria Coren Mitchell, Greg Davies, Simon Day, Greg James, Guz Khan, Gabby Logan, Chris McCausland, Stephen Merchant, Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Angela Scanlon, John Simm, Ranj Singh, Henning Wehn, Claudia Winkleman and Lucy Worsley

programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletchers bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy feels the need to do something special for the Queens Silver Jubilee so he volunteers himself, Clegg, and Compo to help with the towns pageant. However, the need arises to find someone capable of driving a tractor. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg attends the funeral of an old friend, and later tries to convince Foggy and Compo that flowers have emotions and that they react to vocal tone and music. Compos attention is more focused on his own needs, in particular enacting a new plan to drive Nora Batty into his arms. Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brain Wilde star

programme.title: Dont Wait Up
programme.desc: Toby and Angela celebrate their reconciliation with a holiday in Portugal, while Tom concentrates on his future with Madeline. Comedy, starring Nigel Havers and Tony Britton

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: A visit to a local country mansion reveals Boycies admiration for the long-established tradition of respect for the gentry. Elgin moves into Bryans caravan after being thrown out by his wife, leading to relentless gossiping by Mrs Cakeworthy. When the mobile home burns down Marlene offers the two men a place to stay, much to her husbands chagrin. John Challis and Sue Holderness star

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Quite a few feathers are ruffled as Joe Maplin pays a secret visit to the camp and decides Gladys should be promoted to head Yellowcoat - prompting her to sew on some stripes to display her superior rank. With Ruth Madoc, Simon Cadell, Su Pollard and Paul Shane

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletchers bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: The hotel is plunged into chaos by the death of a guest, leading to all manner of mayhem as Basil tries to conceal the corpse from the other occupants. Classic comedy, guest starring Geoffrey Palmer, with John Cleese and Prunella Scales

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Mischievous Basil pretends he has forgotten about his 15th wedding anniversary - but Sybil responds by walking out on him. With friends due to arrive for a celebratory party, the harassed hotelier is forced to take desperate steps to convince them all is well on the marital front. Guest starring Una Stubbs and Ken Campbell

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Manuels pet rat escapes just as a health inspector is about to pay a fact-finding visit, sending Basil on a mad dash to track it down before disaster ensues. Madcap comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales and Andrew Sachs

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: In the first episode of the classic sitcom, beleaguered and badgered hotelier Basil Fawlty tries to attract a better class of clientele, but ends up being taken to the cleaners by the first seemingly upper-crust customer to check in. Dom recalls that Clinton said he was protected and reasons that someone else must know about this mission. They decide to head to Clintons house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why theyre caked in mud. Clintons house yields an interesting discovery - but Dom and Kay are not the only ones breaking in. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo, Hammed Animashaun and Colin Hoult

Sophie hasnt read anything about childbirth and has no idea what lies in store, but luckily partner Martins experience from a previous relationship enables him to provide much-needed support

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Matthew and Jericka bought his grandparents house, but while its big enough to grow into, the design is outdated. Jonathan and Drew rework the main living areas

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: With three kids growing up fast, a familys needs have evolved, and their house is ready for a major change. Jonathan and Drew make the most of a vast main living area

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Homes for Veterans - Part Two
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team continue with their most ambitious project to date, with the assistance of the local community and two royal helpers, Prince William and Prince Harry. The second edition sees them create a home for a veteran, who is a triple amputee after an IED blew up in Afghanistan. They are also aiming to renovate the fronts of the houses on the street and put in new utilities, as well as creating a lasting legacy in the form of a support centre, which will help other veterans find homes and jobs

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: Inspired by the array of cultural sights and sounds in Doha, Qatar, the contestants prepare an elegant fine-dining menu

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: The West Midlands paramedics are dispatched to help a man with a bleed to the head as the result of a bottle attack, and the cab crew speak about male waxing and snakes

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Liverpool Womens Hospital opens its doors to 16-year-old Heidi, who is accompanied by her own mum Jo, and Adele, the mother of the babys father, who has decided to take her sons place in the delivery room. Dad-to-be Gavin hopes poetry will help his jittery wife Michelle get through giving birth to their second child, and 46-year-old Jane finds herself laughing through her daughter Louises contractions as a means of coping with the stress of being a birthing partner

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives of Liverpool Womens Hospital invite viewers into the delivery suites one last time, introducing 27-year-old Gina and her partner James. The pair met at university, while Gina was on an exchange programme from Shanghai, and made their long-distance relationship work by chatting through cuddly toys via the internet. However, they must now demonstrate their maturity and become parents. Meanwhile, self-confessed baby machine Margy arrives expecting her fifth child, and childhood sweethearts Craig and Sarah, who faced parenthood at an early age, look forward to taking their next baby back to their own home rather than to their parents

programme.title: Nurses on the Ward
programme.desc: Caroline treats a father of four with severe pancreatitis, Rhona restores a patients health with a large blood transfusion, and Sarah cares for a mum with incurable stomach cancer

programme.title: Nurses on the Ward
programme.desc: Three newly-qualified nurses Renee, Caitlin and Military Nurse James cope with the pressures of working for the NHS and finding a work-life balance

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants are sent to Wotton House, a grand hotel in the Surrey Hills, where they must each transform one of the nine bedrooms to create a space that reflects their signature style but with an eccentric British twist. The designers relish the challenge, embracing the idea of British eccentricity, although some take a more liberal approach, leading to surprising results. Alan Carr follows their progress, while helping Michelle Ogundehin survey the spaces is guest judge Guy Oliver, who has designed the interiors for some of the best-known hotels in London

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are sent to help a 49-year-old who has fallen in the street after a night out in Stoke, while in Dudley, paramedics visit a five-month-old who has a temperature

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary follows 32-year-old Naomi, who arrives to give birth wearing false eyelashes and full make-up, and single mother-to-be Bianca, who was shocked to discover she was pregnant a few days after her 22nd birthday. Meanwhile, Shannon and her partner Dale were both 17 when they announced they were expecting a baby and have had to deal with people who claim they are too young for the responsibility

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: After inheriting his grandparents house, Alex wants to transform it into a home he can share with his partner, their beloved dogs, and his extensive guitar collection

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: After landing a home in the LA neighbourhood of their dreams, a couple discover that the property is in worse shape than they thought

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team heads to Birmingham to transform the family home of parents Charlotte and Chris, whose twins were born prematurely and have a condition known as global development delay. It has slowed down their progress of walking and talking, but they are further hindered by their cramped house. Nick Knowles and the team join forces with a host of volunteers from the local community to rebuild the familys life and give them a better future

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: On their last day away, the cooks face a final immunity challenge, with one last chance to secure safety in the competition

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: A teenager needs attention from paramedics after suffering an asthma attack on the day of a GCSE exam, and the cab crew discuss dealing with nudist patients

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Self-proclaimed family man James looks forward to the arrival of his fifth child and Kirsty, who was the first triplet to be delivered at Liverpool Womens Hospital returns to have her own baby, hoping motherhood is the key to a more independent life. Meanwhile, an unexpected pregnancy for Jo, still living with her parents at the age of 35, means a busy retirement for first-time grandparents Jean and John

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives at Liverpool Womens Hospital face the mother of all shifts. With the maternity ward full, three couples manage to get a room, but have different experiences. Self-confessed princess Sarah and her devoted fiance Chris arrive eight weeks earlier than expected. Big kid Gary strives to grow up and become the responsible father and husband that his partner Claire demands. And Mormons Chloe and Daniel hope their new baby will bring them a step closer to the large and busy family they dream of

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Rescue and medical teams in a ski resort deal with extreme conditions and daily accidents on the slopes of the French Alps. A pensioner cannot remember what day it is

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: The changing weather causes difficulties on the mountains as the teams rescue a man who has cut open his face and a woman who has fallen 13 metres without a helmet

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers go back to school as they transform students common rooms - and Michelle Ogundehin ups the stakes by telling them that the weakest two will be eliminated this week. Arriving at Gordano School in Bristol, the contestants work in pairs to update the four tired areas - one for each house in the school - as well as adjoining teachers offices. Alan Carr follows their progress, while guest judge Sophie Robinson offers her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: West Midlands paramedics assess a man police have found acting erratically on a busy dual carriageway and believe has taken the powerful psychoactive Monkey Dust

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Newark-on-Trent to Stockton-on-Tees, and a scandalous novel written in Thirsk leads him to a wildlife centre, where he feeds a hungry hedgehog

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Darlington to Dunbar, following the route taken by George Stephensons steam engine on its 1825 journey, and visiting Lewis Carrolls childhood home

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo enjoys a ukulele lesson in Haddington, East Lothian, birthplace of the Victorian self-improvement guru Samuel Smiles. In Musselburgh, he gets a taste of life as a fishwife, before exploring Edinburgh where a popular 19th-century mode of transport is making a comeback. Michael also visits the Royal College of Surgeons, where he discovers the macabre history of body snatchers and murderers and heads onwards to the University of Edinburgh Medical School, to learn how students use sophisticated technology to study anatomy

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Blackpool to Manchester, along the way unveiling a monument to 87 railwaymen of the London and North Western Railway who died in the Great War

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Pauls doing the pick-ups in Lancashire where a rare 1960 Vauxhall Cresta PA Friary estate in dusky pink awaits

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A vivid Dutch DAF 66 - in daffodil yellow - lands at the North Yorkshire showroom

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: The continuing story of the diehards committed to hunt down thousands of Nazi war criminals, some of whom were living in plain sight. One such woman was German Beate Klarsfeld, determined to right the wrongs of her countrys dark past and identify Nazis who had gone unpunished - including the notorious Klaus Barbie. The documentary also tells the story of Josef Mengele - who performed gruesome experiments on Auschwitz inmates - and the son so appalled by his fathers actions he considered turning him in

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of Americas ‘Liberty Ships, which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second visit in this series to Plas Newydd on the Isle of Anglesey. The team examine rarities including a cabinet with a secret function, a magazine rack made by celebrated designer Piero Fornasetti, a collection of historical items related to deafness, a Chinese silver punchbowl and a photo that has a connection to the Apollo 11 mission

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the Queens private residence at Balmoral, Aberdeenshire, where items brought in to be valued include a ceramic pot made by Pablo Picasso, a giant telescope and a diamond tiara. Plus, military specialist Mark Smith challenges Fiona to spot the fake among a collection of rare medals

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale

programme.title: Incredible Journeys with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: A look at the challenge of preserving unspoilt wildernesses, from the icy expanses of Siberia to the tropical forests of central and South America. Simon reflects on how his past series have dealt with the causes and impact of climate change, as well as remembering a memorable report exposing the extent of plastic pollution in the ocean. He also recalls meeting indigenous people around the world and hearing their first-hand experiences of ecological damage

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will are after an Italian car. However, they cannot the true classics so they let the budget dictate the vehicle and settle on an Alfa Romeo 155 from the 1990s. However, its hiding in a barn and making space for an inspection proves a challenge

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek journeys to Essex to collect Pete Woods Austin Allegro, which has been sitting in an aircraft hangar at Audley End for 20 years

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husbands treasured collection of Rolls-Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a beautifully restored and carefully modified 1936 Wolseley 14/56. Meanwhile, a Batman-inspired Chrysler Crossfire is dropped off at the Thornton le Dale garage

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Wincanton, Henry and Simon meet retired blacksmith Gyles with a pile of stuff needing a new home. Simon chooses bellows and Henry fulfils a dream by restoring an airline food trolley

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a picturesque French castle, the ruins of a Kansas City hospital, an ancient Turkish city, and an island in Ireland that brought its inhabitants closer to God

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos journey from the Irish Sea to the North Sea continues by tram from Manchester. At the imposing town hall of the worlds first industrial city, he comes face to face with the Victorian scientist who invented modern atomic theory. The latest stage ends at Silkstone Common, where he tracks down the forge where a Victorian metallurgist created wrought iron axles strong enough for railway rolling stock

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael starts his journey in Chapeltown, Sheffield, following what was once known as the North Country Continental service, and finishing in the engineering centre of Doncaster

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Gainsborough to Ely, along the way learning about a Victorian machine that changed shopping for ever and the poet Alfred Tennyson

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the final leg of his journey following the route of the North Country Continental service. Along the way he meets volunteers on the Mid-Suffolk Light railway and is permitted to drive The Middy. In Leiston, Michael uncovers the worlds first purpose-built assembly line, while in Ipswich the work of a young Victorian engineering prodigy impresses the ex-politician. At his destination of Harwich the presenter discovers how the port became a gateway to the continent, only to be superseded by a new deep-water port further inland

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Pauls on a big day out collecting a 1971 Jaguar E-Type and a 1933 Morgan three-wheeler Supersport, but first theres a flock of 300 chickens to negotiate before he can load up

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves in fast car heaven as he picks up a rare Subaru Impreza and an equally powerful Ford Escort RS Cosworth from North Wales

programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the motivations of key figures in Hitlers regime, beginning with propaganda master Josef Goebbels

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The people responsible for tracking down war criminals who had evaded capture, beginning with the US army task force in charge of locating German scientists

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two episodes from Balmoral, where she takes a tour of the grounds in a 1953 land rover and views archive footage of the royal family. Valuables brought in to be viewed include a collection of medals from both World Wars presented to a man who also rescued survivors from the Titanic, an art nouveau mirror and a 16th-century bottle that survived being unearthed by a digger

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a Christmas special from Lyme Park in Cheshire, where she and toy expert Will Farmer look back at childrens Christmas presents dating back to Edwardian times. In the houses gardens, over 2000 visitors have arrived to have their items valued, including many with a royal heritage. The programme features a cup and saucer once owned by the Queen, a pram from Buckingham Palace, and a dagger believed to have been owned by Charles I. Plus, a celebration of the works of Charles Dickens

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer travels around the islands and mainland coast of the Caribbean Sea, beginning on Hispaniola. He joins the Dominican Republic polices anti-narcotics division, before crossing the border to Haiti to see the notorious tented slums of Cite Soleil, while also discovering a vibrant, colourful and thriving side to the country. He ends this leg of his journey in Puerto Rico, an archipelago that is a territory of the United States, and examines the legacy of bombing and weapons testing on the island of Vieques

programme.desc: A look at the work of mountain vets at the ancient Kingdom of Mourne, Northern Ireland. Nuala diagnoses a deep-rooted infection, finding her only choice is to put the calf down or take on a challenging amputation. programme.title: Mountain Vets

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspicious death in an army barracks, aided by Joe and an enthusiastic member of the military police. Although the demise of commanding officer Dev initially looks like suicide, a case for murder is quickly established and the teams first task is to find a motive. Sensing a connection to Ollie, a soldier killed in Afghanistan, Vera interviews the victims loyal comrades and Ollies grieving family, discovering a traumatic event that nobody wants to talk about. programme.title: Mountain Vets
programme.desc: As winter morphs into spring, lambing and calving keeps the team busy out on the farms. However, their small animal clinic is also packed with pets and Martin Fitzpatrick - the man who founded the practice 35 years ago - faces a difficult case concerning a Highland terrier. Young vet Darren is called out on an emergency to a farm where a prize cow is struggling to deliver a calf. An examination reveals its simply too big to come out naturally. Darren decides the safest option, for both the cow and the calf, is to perform an emergency Caesarean section. Its a risky operation, but without it, the cow will die

programme.title: Mountain Vets
programme.desc: Newly qualified vet Patrick is called out to help a farmer whose cow has been struggling all night with a difficult labour. Patrick discovers her calf is breached, and has to reposition it. However, once its in the correct position, a shock discovery makes his job twice as precarious. Back in Castlewellan, a farmer arrives with a two-week-old lamb thats developed a limp. Some antibiotics and a dose of anti-inflammatories will help the lamb back on its feet. However, vet Maeve notices its eyes are milky white and she has to use all her expertise and knowledge to save the lambs sight
